channel.title: Vanguard News » Sports
channel.description: A Nigerian newspaper and Online version of the Vanguard, a daily publication in Nigeria covering Niger delta, general national news, politics, business, energy, sports, entertainment, fashion,lifestyle human interest stories, etc

item.title: Rio Olympics: Why Falcons crashed – Onyedinma
item.dc:creator: adekunle
item.description:
Chairman of the Nigeria Women Football League Mrs. Dilichukwu Onyedinma has revealed that the absence of eight key members of the Super Falcons made the team to lose 2-1 loss to Equatorial Guinea in last weekend’s 2016 Rio Olympics Games qualifier in Bata.

The post Rio Olympics: Why Falcons crashed – Onyedinma appeared first on Vanguard News.

item.title: Black Stars, Eagles to clash in London
item.dc:creator: adekunle
item.description:
Nigeria have proposed a friendly against perennial rivals Ghana in London next month, it has been gathered.

The post Black Stars, Eagles to clash in London appeared first on Vanguard News.

item.title: Siasia eyes All Africa Games gold
item.dc:creator: adekunle
item.description:
Ahead of the 2015 All Africa Games (AAG) taking place in Congo Brazzaville next month, Chief Coach of the national U-23 team, the Dream Team IV, Samson Siasia says his target at the championship is to win the gold medal of the soccer event.

The post Siasia eyes All Africa Games gold appeared first on Vanguard News.

item.title: Eaglets know W/Cup foes today
item.dc:creator: adekunle
item.description:
The Golden Eaglets and other big names like Brazil, Argentina and Germany will today know their group opponents as the draw for the FIFA U-17 World Cup will hold in Santiago, Chile.

The post Eaglets know W/Cup foes today appeared first on Vanguard News.

item.title: 6th Hope 4 Girls camp begins
item.dc:creator: adekunle
item.description:
The annual Hope 4 Girls basketball Camp put together by former Nigerian international, Mobolaji Akiode commences today at the Nigeria Institute for Sports Gymnasium inside the National Stadium Surulere, Lagos.

The post 6th Hope 4 Girls camp begins appeared first on Vanguard News.

item.title: Oliseh to ring closing bell at NSE
item.dc:creator: adekunle
item.description:
The Amaju –Pinnick led Executive Committee of Nigeria Football Federation will record another first on Monday, August 17, when Super Eagles’ Head Coach, Sunday Oliseh, will perform the significant ringing of the bell at the closing of business at the Nigeria Stock Exchange.

The post Oliseh to ring closing bell at NSE appeared first on Vanguard News.

item.title: Enyimba remain top after draw with Akwa Utd
item.dc:creator: adekunle
item.description:
Enyimba maintained their leadership of the Nigeria league table after they played out a 2-2 draw at Akwa United in a Week 21 game in Uyo on Wednesday.

The post Enyimba remain top after draw with Akwa Utd appeared first on Vanguard News.

item.title: Boxing coach optimistic Nigeria will win 4 gold medals at All Africa Games
item.dc:creator: adekunle
item.description:
Adura Olalehin, a national boxing coach has expressed optimism that the country will clinch a minimum of four gold medals in boxing at the forthcoming All Africa Games in Congo Brazzaville.

The post Boxing coach optimistic Nigeria will win 4 gold medals at All Africa Games appeared first on Vanguard News.

item.title: We must beat Tanzania, Oliseh vows
item.dc:creator: adekunle
item.description:
Super Eagles’ Head Coach, Sunday Oliseh, will return to the country next week, as preparations hit top gear for next month’s 2017 Africa Cup of Nations qualifying match against Tanzania in Dar es Salaam.

The post We must beat Tanzania, Oliseh vows appeared first on Vanguard News.

item.title: Enyimba target 7th league title
item.dc:creator: adekunle
item.description:
Enyimba head coach Kadiri Ikhana has said the ambition of the side is to win a record seventh title in the ongoing Nigeria top flight.

The post Enyimba target 7th league title appeared first on Vanguard News.
